results:
Based on my search results, I found comprehensive information about the Polish translation of George Orwell's "1984" ("Rok 1984") by Juliusz Mieroszewski published in 1953 by the Paris-based Instytut Literacki:

## Key findings:

**Translation and Publication Details:**
- The first Polish translation by Juliusz Mieroszewski was published in exile at the Instytut Literacki in Paris in 1953
- The book was titled "1984. Powieść" (1984. A Novel), translated from English by Juliusz Mieroszewski, published in Paris 1953 by Instytut Literacki
- It was published as part of the "Biblioteka 'Kultury'" (Culture Library) series, volume 2

**Censorship and Ban in Communist Poland:**
- Until the fall of the communist system in Poland (1989), this novel was banned by censorship
- In the People's Republic of Poland (PRL), "1984" was banned by censorship, and the first Polish translation by Juliusz Mieroszewski published in Paris in 1953
- Since "1984" openly criticized the communist system, the book was banned in Poland until 1989

**Underground Circulation:**
- From 1980, however, it was published as reprints of the Paris edition in independent publishing houses - the so-called "second circulation"
- Until that time, it functioned in the so-called "second circulation"

**First Official Polish Edition:**
- The first official edition (PIW) was in 1988
- It was officially published for the first time only in 1988

**Physical Description:**
- The book was 16d format, 254 pages, [1]
- On the pre-title page: "Rok tysiąc dziewięćset osiemdziesiąty czwarty" (The year one thousand nine hundred and eighty-four)

This translation was historically significant as the first Polish edition of Orwell's visionary book, and it played an important role in Polish intellectual resistance against communist censorship, circulating underground for decades before being officially published.
